description: Primes p such that x^64 = -2 has a solution mod p.
comments: Differs from A051085 first at the 541st entry, at p=15809. [From R. J. Mathar, Oct 14 2008]Contribution from _Christopher J. Smyth_, Jul 24 2009: (Start)Differs from A163183 (primes dividing 2^j+1 for some odd j) at the 827th entry, at p=25601. See comment at A163186 for explanation.Sequence is union of A163183 and A163186 (primes p such that the equation x^64 = -2 mod p has a solution, and ord_p(-2) is even).(End)Complement of A216777 relative to A000040. - _Vincenzo Librandi_, Sep 17 2012
links: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
mathematica: ok[p_]:= Reduce[Mod[x^64 + 2, p] == 0, x, Integers] =!= False; Select[Prime[Range[400]], ok] (* _Vincenzo Librandi_, Sep 16 2012 *)
prog: (PARI)forprime(p=2, 2000, if([]~!=polrootsmod(x^64+2, p), print1(p, ", "))); print();/* _Joerg Arndt_, Jun 24 2012 */(MAGMA) [p: p in PrimesUpTo(1200) | exists(t){x : x in ResidueClassRing(p) | x^64 eq - 2}]; // _Vincenzo Librandi_, Sep 16 2012
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
extensions: Added more terms, Joerg Arndt, Jul 27 2011.
